subject: Creativity
title: The Future of Imagination: Virtual Worlds and Digital Minds
description: A 60-second lesson on The Future of Imagination: Virtual Worlds and Digital Minds.

hook.text: VR lets you inhabit impossible bodies, visit alien worlds, and experience other lives. What does this do to imagination?

buildup.text: Virtual reality is 'externalized imagination' ‚Äî making internal mental worlds shareable, explorable, and collaborative.

discovery.text: Studies show VR experiences in another person's body increase empathy more than reading, watching films, or any other.

twist.text: But some researchers worry: if VR provides pre-built imaginary worlds, will our internal imagination skills atrophy.

climax.text: AI-generated content now creates images from text descriptions.

punchline.text: The question isn't what we'll imagine next. It's whether we'll still need to.

quiz.question: What concern do some researchers have about VR and imagination?
options: Pre-built worlds may cause internal imagination to atrophy
